main event: On January 7, 1948, at Godman Air Force Base in Kentucky, several military personnel observed a large, bright, circular unidentified object for over an hour.
interesting points: The initial reports indicated the object was possibly 250 to 300 feet in diameter, The speed of the object was reported to be approximately 180 to 360 MPH, Capt. Thomas Mantell was killed attempting to pursue the object, There were at least four P-51 aircraft involved in the pursuit of the object, The sighting led to multiple eyewitness accounts from military personnel at Godman AFB.
witness description: Officers and pilots from Godman Field, including Capt. Cary W. Carter, Lt. Paul I. Orner, and T/Sgt Quinton A. Blackwell.
